issue.title: CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes
CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes

content.raw:
The count is determined by a [filter expression](#!/osrf/cloudsim-client-tools/src/f80e9ecd13f3604d810011ea8301b965aa42cf6c/vrc_bytecounter/src/byteCounter.c?at=default#cl-305), which is basically checking for a packet that is:

1. from or to {sim, fc1, fc2} AND
2. NOT from or to router

(There's other stuff in there to not count NTP and DNS queries coming from the sim machine.)

It makes sense that if you're sending multicast packets between fc1 and fc2, the router will overhear them and they'll be caught by that filter.  As you've guessed, we tested with ROS comms, which is unicast, and didn't put in support for multicast.

This should be easy to fix.  Digging into pcap-filter....
content.html:
The count is determined by a filter expression, which is basically checking for a packet that is:

  1. from or to {sim, fc1, fc2} AND
  2. NOT from or to router

(There's other stuff in there to not count NTP and DNS queries coming from the sim machine.)

It makes sense that if you're sending multicast packets between fc1 and fc2, the router will overhear them and they'll be caught by that filter. As you've guessed, we tested with ROS comms, which is unicast, and didn't put in support for multicast.

This should be easy to fix. Digging into pcap-filter....

issue.title: CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes
CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes

content.raw:
Debugging filter expression in an environment where multicast is in use between fc1 and fc2:

Original expression (not including the NTP/DNS sim exclusion):
~~~
$ sudo tcpdump -i bond0 "(ip host (10.0.0.51 or 10.0.0.52 or 10.0.0.53) and not 10.0.0.50)"                     
tcpdump: verbose output suppressed, use -v or -vv for full protocol decode
listening on bond0, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
10:21:01.923783 IP 10.0.0.53.53743 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1420
10:21:01.923808 IP 10.0.0.53.53743 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1038
10:21:01.955823 IP 10.0.0.52.34324 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1420
10:21:01.955844 IP 10.0.0.52.34324 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1028
~~~

Add `and not ip multicast`:
~~~
$ sudo tcpdump -i bond0 "(ip host (10.0.0.51 or 10.0.0.52 or 10.0.0.53) and not 10.0.0.50) and not ip multicast"
tcpdump: verbose output suppressed, use -v or -vv for full protocol decode
listening on bond0, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
10:21:39.861898 IP 10.0.0.53.ntp > mighty.poclabs.net.ntp: NTPv4, Client, length 48
10:21:39.889722 IP mighty.poclabs.net.ntp > 10.0.0.53.ntp: NTPv4, Server, length 48
10:21:40.841784 IP 10.0.0.52.9000 > 11.8.0.2.9001: UDP, length 8
10:21:42.974399 IP 10.0.0.52.9000 > 11.8.0.2.9001: UDP, length 8
~~~
content.html:
Debugging filter expression in an environment where multicast is in use between fc1 and fc2:

Original expression (not including the NTP/DNS sim exclusion):

$ sudo tcpdump -i bond0 "(ip host (10.0.0.51 or 10.0.0.52 or 10.0.0.53) and not 10.0.0.50)"                     
tcpdump: verbose output suppressed, use -v or -vv for full protocol decode
listening on bond0, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
10:21:01.923783 IP 10.0.0.53.53743 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1420
10:21:01.923808 IP 10.0.0.53.53743 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1038
10:21:01.955823 IP 10.0.0.52.34324 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1420
10:21:01.955844 IP 10.0.0.52.34324 > 239.255.76.67.7667: UDP, length 1028

Add and not ip multicast:

$ sudo tcpdump -i bond0 "(ip host (10.0.0.51 or 10.0.0.52 or 10.0.0.53) and not 10.0.0.50) and not ip multicast"
tcpdump: verbose output suppressed, use -v or -vv for full protocol decode
listening on bond0, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
10:21:39.861898 IP 10.0.0.53.ntp > mighty.poclabs.net.ntp: NTPv4, Client, length 48
10:21:39.889722 IP mighty.poclabs.net.ntp > 10.0.0.53.ntp: NTPv4, Server, length 48
10:21:40.841784 IP 10.0.0.52.9000 > 11.8.0.2.9001: UDP, length 8
10:21:42.974399 IP 10.0.0.52.9000 > 11.8.0.2.9001: UDP, length 8

issue.title: CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes

content.raw: Believe that it's fixed by [cloudsim-client-tools pull request #16](#!/osrf/cloudsim-client-tools/pull-request/16).  Reopen if that's not the case.
content.html: Believe that it's fixed by cloudsim-client-tools pull request #16. Reopen if that's not the case.

issue.title: CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes

content.raw: Brian, your change to the issue title is incorrect - the router was counting fc2 to fc1 last night. (obviously neither should be counted)
content.html: Brian, your change to the issue title is incorrect - the router was counting fc2 to fc1 last night. (obviously neither should be counted)

issue.title: CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes
CloudSim is counting multicast packets sent from fc2 to fc1 in the up/downlink quotes

content.raw: @faller , thanks for the tip on the title; fixed.  The original title incorrectly read "fc2 to fc2", and I apparently chose the wrong one to change.
content.html: @faller , thanks for the tip on the title; fixed. The original title incorrectly read "fc2 to fc2", and I apparently chose the wrong one to change.
